result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
11:10 AM   State and County appear by Attorney Alexandra Smathers. Defendant, Ricardo Mendoza, appeared in custody with Attorney Michelle M. Gardner.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: 22CF932/22TR5430. In Case 22CF932 Court finds the deft is not competent to proceed at this time.  Deft is committed to the Dept of Health Services.  DHS shall determine the placement. Credit of 55 days.  Reports shall be submitted at three mos intervals.  Case is suspended. 22TR5430 continues to trail Case 22CF932.
CH set for 8/30/22 at 11 am is rescheduled to 9/2/22 at 11 am as Dr. Goebel is not available on 8/30/22. Attorney Knapp and the State notified by email.

03:32 PM   State appears by Attorney Alexandra Smathers. Defendant, Ricardo Mendoza, appeared in custody with Attorney Michelle M. Knapp.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: 22CF932/22TR5430. The Doctor does not appear by zoom. Clerk calls the Doctor's office and receptionist advises Court that Doctor is out of the office right now and did not have a zoom appointment scheduled for today. The State is requesting to proceed without the Doctor and to use the report. Attorney Knapp is objecting and states the DE would like the Doctor present at the hearing. Court will adjourn. TR file continues to trail Case 22CF932.  Competency hearing scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Minutes:  10:24AM.  22CF932/22TR5430.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Daniel Tombasco appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody along w/Atty Michelle Knapp.  Defense counsel reports the deft is contesting the findings in the report.  CH (evidentiary) set for 8/24/22 @ 3:30pm.  Doctor may testify via Zoom.  TR file is trailing.
along with Cover Sheet for Confidential Records
Order CR 205 and crim complaint sent to DHS, WCS notified, copy to KCJ

Defendant Ricardo Mendoza appeared with Attorney Michelle M. Knapp.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Daniel Alejandro Bernard Deida appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:   Atty Knapp raises issue of competency; Court orders Comp Exam.  Bond continued.  Competency hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
